content.description:
A Chance Encounter

Cui1mater media sese tulit obviasese ferre obvius, -a, -um (+ dat.): to encounter silva, 
virginis os habitumhabitus, -us, m. = vestis, -isque gerens et virginis arma 
SpartanaeSpartanus, -a, -um, adj.: Spartan, of Sparta, vel qualis equos ThreissaThreissus, -a, -um, adj.: Thracian, of Thrace fatigatfatigo, -are: to tire 
HarpalyceHarpalyce, -es, f.: Harpalyce (the daughter of a Thracian king and legendary fast runner) volucremvolucer, -cris, -cre, adj. = celer, -eris, -ereque fuga praevertiturpraevertor, -i: to outrun HebrumHebrus, -i, m.: the Hebrus (river).
 1:refers to Aeneas↩
content.question: Which Latin word in the passage does gerens (line 2) modify?

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2

skill.text: 1.B: Describe how grammar contributes to the meaning and function of Latin words and phrases in context.
